newsitem.title: PORTUGAL: Portugal, Indonesia to hold Timor talks in October.
newsitem.headline: Portugal, Indonesia to hold Timor talks in October.

text.p: New ambassadorial-level talks between Portugal and Indonesia about the disputed territory of East Timor will be held in early October, a Portuguese Foreign Ministry spokeswoman said on Wednesday.

The two countries will meet in New York where a first round of discussions was held this month under the chairmanship of Pakistani diplomat Jamseed Marker, U.N. Secretary-General Kofi Annan's special representative for East Timor.
The talks are part of a new bid by Annan to find a solution to the long-running diplomatic tussle over the territory, which Indonesia annexed in 1976 after a bloody invasion.
The United Nations has never recognised Jakarta's occupation and regards Portugal, the former colonial ruler, as its legal administrator.

Years of regular meetings between the two countries' foreign ministers made little progress so Annan opted for a new approach, reducing the level of the contacts but increasing their frequency in the hope of reaching some common ground.
Portugal backs the call of East Timor resistance groups for a referendum in the territory to let its people decide their future.
Jakarta says that East Timor tribal leaders freely agreed to integration with Indonesia in 1976.
